content.raw: If we can't get at the model offset from here, then I would leave it hardcoded.
content.html: If we can't get at the model offset from here, then I would leave it hardcoded.

content.raw:
In that case, I'm OK with leaving it as is.  50m will cover our immediate use cases and we can always increase it if needed.

It would be better to go all the way to the limits to cover every possible case, but that's not urgent (and, as you point out, would require changes in Gazebo).
content.html:
In that case, I'm OK with leaving it as is. 50m will cover our immediate use cases and we can always increase it if needed.

It would be better to go all the way to the limits to cover every possible case, but that's not urgent (and, as you point out, would require changes in Gazebo).

content.raw: well, the bottom of the feet is found at [0.93m with artificial model offset added](#!/osrf/drcsim/src/c69ecab26a55/ros/atlas_description/urdf/atlas.gazebo?at=default#cl-4).  I am not sure I know of a good way to get at that data.  Maybe I can create a testRay that shoots upwards and detects bottom Bounding Box boundary of the Atlas model given Atlas configuration may vary as well?
content.html: well, the bottom of the feet is found at 0.93m with artificial model offset added. I am not sure I know of a good way to get at that data. Maybe I can create a testRay that shoots upwards and detects bottom Bounding Box boundary of the Atlas model given Atlas configuration may vary as well?

content.raw: well, the ray is hard-coded to be [1000m](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/a3b9596dc9e6ee289fe03c603102a4561ac1dc4f/gazebo/physics/World.cc?at=default#cl-1551), I can try changing it to a ray of `DBL_MAX` length and put the beginning of it at maybe `DBL_MAX/2`?
content.html: well, the ray is hard-coded to be 1000m, I can try changing it to a ray of DBL_MAX length and put the beginning of it at maybe DBL_MAX/2?

content.raw: Does `1.11` include some knowledge of the height of Atlas's origin?  Is there a way to get that value at runtime?
content.html: Does 1.11 include some knowledge of the height of Atlas's origin? Is there a way to get that value at runtime?

content.raw: Will `z=50.0` always be sufficient?  E.g., what if I use a tall terrain map or have decided to position my ground plane above `z=0.0` for some reason?  Can we make `z=DBL_MAX` or equivalent?
content.html: Will z=50.0 always be sufficient? E.g., what if I use a tall terrain map or have decided to position my ground plane above z=0.0 for some reason? Can we make z=DBL_MAX or equivalent?

content.raw: initial try on `qual_task_1.world`, `World::testRay` does not see the raised box stage.  Reason being ground plane and platform\_1 has the same collision names, need [this patch](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/341/patch-to-fix-world-getentitybelowpoint) for this to work.
content.html: initial try on qual_task_1.world, World::testRay does not see the raised box stage. Reason being ground plane and platform_1 has the same collision names, need this patch for this to work.
